name: hyperexcitability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a state in which there are very strong reactions to stimuli (= things that cause a physical reaction): Hyperexcitability caused by steroid use could be evidence of impaired brain function. Use of this medication in children may cause hyper-excitability and nightmares.
More examplesFewer examplesMost authorities agree that true cramps are caused by hyperexcitability of the nerves that stimulate the muscles.The idea that radiation affects the neurons' hyper-excitability without killing them is very intriguing but totally speculation.With chronic frequent use of hard drugs, euphoria is replaced by restlessness, hyper-excitability, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.
